title: India's growth story is 'very mixed' right now; a rate cut in August is unlikely: Economist
text: Sakshi Gupta, Principal Economist at HDFC Bank, says that while government spending and support for infrastructure and capital goods remain strong, consumption growth in India is lagging, evident in high-frequency indicators like passenger vehicle sales, which have been weak. On employment, she adds that a meaningful pickup is still awaited.

title: Australian Inflation Continued to Cool in Second Quarter
text: Inflation continued to ease in the second quarter, raising bets that the Australian central bank will deliver a rate cut next month.

title: Reasons To Stay Bullish
text: Consumer confidence and Q2 GDP data point to continued economic resilience, supporting the case for further market growth in the near term. Upcoming earnings from Mag7 companies are likely to beat expectations, fueled by robust economic conditions.

title: Singapore's Central Bank Leaves Monetary Policy Untouched As Tariffs Loom

title: Trump's pharmaceutical tariffs could affect some drugmakers more than others
text: President Donald Trump is slated to impose tariffs on pharmaceuticals imported into the U.S. any day now – and they may have a bigger impact on some drugmakers than others. AbbVie, Bristol Myers Squibb and Eli Lilly appear "relatively well-positioned" based on their manufacturing footprint in the U.S. compared to abroad, while Novartis and Roche look more at risk, TD Cowen analyst Steve Scala said in a note.

title: The Trump Tariff Playbook: Why the Bears Got it Wrong
text: Seven months into 2025, and President Donald Trump's ‘Liberation Day' is the story of the year on Wall Street thus far. On April 2nd, Trump signed an executive order imposing ‘reciprocal tariffs' on America's trading partners, with a minimum 10% tariff on all US imports. Although Donald Trump had talked about how the United States has been getting ripped off on trade for more than three decades, Wall Street investors were caught off guard by the magnitude and aggressiveness of Trump's tariff plan.

text: The European Union-U.S. trade agreement has been met with scepticism as concerns over what it means for the bloc have emerged. Some experts however argue that it could benefit the U.K.

title: European leaders criticize the U.S.-EU trade deal
text: European leaders across the continent voice their frustrations with the terms of the U.S.-EU trade deal and the pressure it will put on the bloc's economy.

title: Dax Index News: Forecast Brightens as Tech Stocks Lead Rebound Today
text: DAX edges higher despite auto sector concerns over US-EU deal. Traders eye US confidence data, labor market trends, and the upcoming Fed interest rate decision.

title: Spain retail sales rise 6.2% year-on-year in June
text: Spanish retail sales rose 6.2% in June from a year earlier on a calendar-adjusted basis and excluding the effects of inflation, after rising by a revised 5.0% in May, the National Statistics Institute (INE) said on Tuesday.

title: India's IPO boom depends on a thriving secondary market: JPMorgan
text: Abhinav Bharti, Head of India Equity Capital Markets at JPMorgan, says organic capital creation in the Indian market has been on a stable trajectory. He notes that "secondary markets will always be a driver for primary markets", with capital raising usually taking a "breather" when there's extreme volatility in the secondary markets.

title: Surprisingly Positive Tariffs
text: With August tariff extensions looming, several major companies are now guiding for reduced tariff impacts, a shift that has helped boost market sentiment this earnings season. Firms like Johnson & Johnson and 3M have moved from worst-case tariff scenarios to improved earnings guidance, suggesting earlier fears were overstated.

title: 'Rest Of World' Equities Finally Break Out
text: In the last month or so, we've seen international equities finally break out to new all-time highs above two key resistance levels. International equities recovered from the COVID crash much more slowly than the US, and it has taken until this year for them to finally break out again.

title: As Trump's tariff regime becomes clear, Americans may start to foot the bill
text: Every company at every stage of the supply chain will try to pass on the cost of US tariffs, as much as possible

title: Hang Seng Index News: EV and Tech Losses Drag Markets Amid Trade Uncertainty
text: Hang Seng Index falls as US-China trade tensions rise. Tech stocks slide on NVIDIA export woes, weighing on broader market sentiment.

title: US tariffs to dampen growth of Southeast Asian countries by up to 80 basis points: DBS
text: Radhika Rao of DBS Bank outlines the impact of tariffs on Southeast Asian countries even if they managed to lower U.S. reciprocal tariffs to between 15% and 20%.

title: President Trump's tariff rollout has taken numerous twists and turns since launching earlier this year. Here's a roundup of where things stand.
text: A roundup of where things stand with tariffs on key U.S. trade partners and sectors.

title: President Trump's tariff rollout has taken numerous twists and turns since launching earlier this year. Here's a roundup of where things stand.
text: A roundup of where things stand with tariffs on key U.S. trade partners and sectors.

title: Federal Reserve officials expect they will need to resume lowering interest rates eventually—they just aren't ready to do so Wednesday
text: Officials are split into three camps over what economic evidence they need before resuming rate reductions. Two governors are prepared to dissent on Wednesday.

title: Oil climbs on EU trade deal, potential US-China tariff truce extension
text: Oil extended gains on Tuesday, lifted by hopes of improved economic activity after the U.S.-EU trade deal, a potential U.S.-China tariff truce and President Donald Trump's shorter deadline for Russia to end the Ukraine war.

title: Consumers want high quality goods at reasonable prices, says Jim Cramer
text: 'Mad Money' host Jim Cramer hones in on luxury fashion brand Tapestry.

title: August: Time to Unplug from Markets?
text: While stocks continue to print fresh all-time highs, the 'sell the news' phenomenon, August post-election seasonality, and 'The Warren Buffett Indicator,' suggest that August may be a good time for active investors to take their foot off the gas pedal.

title: Jim Cramer on why the market put tariff deals on the back burner
text: 'Mad Money' host Jim Cramer explains why the EU tariff announcement did not do much to move the market today.

title: I've never been a 'free trader', says Jim Cramer
text: 'Mad Money' host Jim Cramer explains why the EU tariff announcement did not do much to move the market today.

title: Commerce Secretary Lutnick celebrates Trump's 'monster' EU trade deal as 'huge' win for America
text: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick discusses the significance of the U.S. and EU agreeing to a trade deal on 'Special Report.'

title: Jim Cramer explains why Trump's trade deals didn't bring on a market rally
text: CNBC's Jim Cramer examined Monday's market action and said he thinks the U.S.'s major trade deals failed to move stocks because investors' focus is elsewhere this week. "Right now, we're presuming these tariffs don't matter," he said.

title: Good News, Bad News, and Profiting on Both
text: Good news on the trade war. Over the weekend, the U.S. and EU agreed on a framework deal that sets a 15% tariff on most EU exports to the U.S. – down from a threatened 30% and sharply reducing trade war risk.

title: Chart Master: Don't bet on the markets
text: Carter Worth, Worth Charting, joins 'Fast Money' to talk the technical indicators he is flagging in the current bull run.

title: Housing prices continue to rise but investors see opportunities, how tariffs will impact toy prices
text: Asking for a Trend anchor Josh Lipton breaks down the latest market trends for July 28, 2025. Affordability and higher mortgage rates are keeping homebuyers out of the real estate market.

title: 55% tariffs on Chinese goods will hurt holiday shopping, says market researcher David Riedel
text: David Riedel, Riedel Research, joins 'Fast Money' to explain why he believes Chinese tariffs are going to hit U.S. consumers hard in the coming months.

title: Rate cuts may come in in December, expert predicts
text: BNY Investments chief economist Vincent Reinhart discusses concerns over the Federal Reserve's next moves on 'The Claman Countdown.' #foxbusienss #ratecuts #interestrate #inflation #federalreserve

title: U.S.-EU Trade Deal: A One-Sided Affair
text: I was skeptical about the Trump administration's ability to secure a trade deal with the EU, given complex EU politics and internal resistance. Despite significant barriers and pessimism from both sides, a deal was reached after high-level talks in Scotland, and the US seems to have gotten the better end of it.

title: Indexes Mixed After Trump-EU Deal As Mag 7 Earnings, Fed Meeting Loom
text: The Dow Jones index fell but the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq scored another record close in Monday's stock market. Oil rose.

title: Big Tech earnings are biggest risk to equities this week, says Citi's Stuart Kaiser
text: Stuart Kaiser, Citi Head of Equity Trading Strategy, joins 'Fast Money' to talk what is moving the markets and what could change the trajectory of equities.

title: 'Fast Money' traders look ahead to trade deadlines, Fed meeting, and more Big Tech earnings
text: The 'Fast Money' traders look ahead to trade deadlines, Fed meeting, and more Big Tech earnings.

title: G Squared's Victoria Greene on names she is watching this earnings season
text: Victoria Greene, G Squared Private Wealth, joins 'Closing Bell Overtime' to talk the stock names she is watching this earnings season including: UnitedHealth, Boeing, Nucor, and more.

title: Dollar Climbs Most Since May as US-EU Strike Trade Deal
text: Wall Street kicked off a pivotal week with the dollar climbing the most since May as a tariff deal between President Donald Trump and the European Union bolstered hopes for an extension of a China trade truce. Stocks wavered near all-time highs.

title: Stocks Keep Streak of Records Going Following Europe-U.S. Trade Deal
text: The euro fell against the U.S. dollar amid European pushback over the pact. The Nasdaq Composite and S&P 500 inched up to fresh records.

title: U.S.-E.U. Trade Deal Lifts Oil By Over 2.5%, But Will The Rally Last?
text: Oil futures rose by over 2.5% on Monday following an easing of trade tensions between the U.S. and the European Union, but doubts remain over the strength of the rally.

title: U.S. economy will probably slow later this year, says Wells Fargo's Semana
text: Sameer Semana, Wells Fargo, joins 'Closing Bell Overtime' to talk the day's market action.

title: The Stock Market Is Taking a Tougher Line on Earnings Misses
text: Investors are dumping stocks in companies that don't meet profit forecasts or offer positive financial guidance more aggressively than usual.

title: The E.U. says it will buy $750 billion of U.S. energy products. Why that's ‘absurd.
text: President Donald Trump said the U.S. deal on tariffs and trade with the European Union includes Brussels' agreement to buy $750 billion of U.S. energy products over the next three years, but industry analysts say the math doesn't even remotely add up.

title: US IPO Market Ramps Up
text: As Figma prepares to go public with shares priced between $30–$32, the Head of Late-Stage Growth at Wellington Management, Matt Witheiler, says the VC-backed IPO market is back. He explains what is behind the resurgence of public listings on “Bloomberg Tech.

title: Beta as a metric is one of the more vulnerable areas of the market, says Renaissance Macro's deGraaf
text: Jeff deGraaf, Renaissance Macro, joins 'Closing Bell' to discuss deGraaf's take on recent equity market performance, general readings on market behavior and much more.

title: The US & EU have reached a trade deal, but don't expect it to be a framework for China
text: The US and EU have agreed on a framework for a trade deal that includes a 15% levy on goods imported into the US from the EU. But Council on Foreign Relations senior fellow Zoe Liu says there are two reasons why a US deal with China won't follow that same model.

title: EU & U.S. Trade Deal a Big Step Forward, Still a Long Road Ahead
text: While the EU trade deal is a big step forward for the U.S. solidifying tariffs, Michelle Gibley with @CharlesSchwab says there's still plenty of outstanding deals that need to be reached. Canada and China are the countries she believes need the greatest amount of focus.

title: Investors Got Bruised, Then They Got Up. What Will They Get Next?
text: The mood on Wall Street feels a bit like discovering that nothing is broken after a hard fall.

title: Structural Issues In The U.S. Pale Next To Those Of China
text: The U.S. has significant structural issues including a near record high debt to GDP ratio and a market selling at extreme valuations. However, in some ways the U.S. is the best house in a bad neighborhood, with both Japan and China carrying higher debt loads and worse demographic trends.

title: Who Pays for U.S. Tariffs, and Where Does the Money Go?
text: President Trump is seeking to raise federal revenue by imposing levies on goods from foreign nations. Here's how the process works.

title: Trump is 'Powell's scapegoat,' Pangaea policy founder says
text: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell will announce the central bank's latest interest rate decision and deliver remarks on Wednesday, with the market expecting rates to hold steady. Bank of America Securities senior US economist Stephen Juneau and Pangaea Policy founder Terry Haines discuss what they expect from the Fed meeting.

title: Can President Trump Fire Fed Chief Powell? What This Transition Could Mean For Markets
text: Wall Street watchers are speculating whether or not a Federal Reserve shakeup is headed our way. President Trump says Fed Chairman Jerome Powell is "too late" on cutting interest rates, but can that alone result in a firing?

title: U.S. Treasury expects to borrow $1T for Q3, higher than earlier announced
text: CNBC's Megan Cassella reports on news regarding the Treasury Department.

title: Rate Cut or Rate Hike? Tariffs, Jobs & Inflation Leave Fed's Path Uncertain
text: Peter Tchir and John Lekas both share concern on the direction of the job market, but they differ on what it means for interest rates. Peter estimates up to three rate cuts before the end of 2025 starting in September.

title: Tariffs & Earnings
text: While the U.S. Federal Reserve (Fed) is clearly concerned about the uncertainty surrounding the impact of tariffs on the economy, supply chains, and inflation, Wall Street analysts appear to be more confident that the unknown will not likely extend to S&P 500 Index earnings.

title: Wall Street thrives while Main Street struggles: Financial Stress Index soars to pandemic-era levels
text: Neils Christensen has a diploma in journalism from Lethbridge College and has more than a decade of reporting experience working for news organizations throughout Canada. His experiences include covering territorial and federal politics in Nunavut, Canada.

title: U.S.-China trade talks are showing signs of détente, says MCC Global's Michelle Caruso-Cabrera
text: CNBC's Eamon Javers and Michelle Caruso-Cabrera, MCC Global Enterprises CEO, join 'Power Lunch' to discuss the United States' trade policies with the rest of the world.

title: Even with high tariffs, Trump's trade war suddenly is starting to look not so scary on Wall Street
text: Tariffs appear to be settling only slightly less than what President Donald Trump had threatened in April, but the difference has been enough to ease some of Wall Street's worst recession fears. Economists cite a strong global growth backdrop, a less-than-expected inflationary impact of the tariffs and a general easing in financial conditions as reasons for why the landscape looks less dire.

title: Judge in Fed rate meeting access case asks if lawsuit is publicity stunt for fund
text: A judge questioned whether a lawsuit seeking to force the Federal Reserve to open to the public a meeting on setting interest rates is a publicity stunt to generate interest in the new investment fund that filed the civil complaint. Judge Beryl Howell, during a hearing on the request, noted that the CEO of the plaintiff, Azoria Capital, had discussed the suit last week during an interview on a Fox Business show, "Mornings with Maria," which was mentioned in a court filing.

title: Where Morgan Stanley is looking for value after powerful rebound in U.S. stocks
text: The stock market was trading mixed Monday, after President Donald Trump announced on Sunday a trade deal with the Europe Union.

title: What Are The Ramifications For Investors After The U.S./EU Trade Deal?
text: The EU-U.S. trade deal boosts U.S. LNG suppliers, with the EU committing to $750 billion in purchases over three years—making LNG stocks attractive buys. A flat 15% tariff on EU imports to the U.S. is half that of the threat but will impact European luxury automakers and small firms in general.

title: Why Are Stocks Still Rallying Despite Tariff Uncertainty? | Presented by CME Group
text: Given the uncertainty around tariffs and trade policy, investors might have anticipated subdued conditions in equity markets — yet the Relative Strength Index, which measures momentum, has signaled overbought conditions several times this month. Why are stocks still rallying despite tariff uncertainty, and how can the Relative Strength Index help investors navigate these unusual market conditions?

title: Fed Chair Powell will punt on rate cuts this week, Coronado says
text: Julia Coronado, Macropolicy Perspectives President and Founder, joins Open Interest to discuss the impact of tariffs on US companies and consumers. -------- More on Bloomberg Television and Markets Like this video?

title: Why the Fed will likely keep interest rates unchanged at its upcoming meeting
text: The U.S. central bank, to President Donald Trump's chagrin, will likely leave interest rates unchanged at a policy meeting this week, but that's not to say there won't be a vigorous debate, with one if not two Federal Reserve governors possibly casting a rare dissent in support of lower borrowing costs.

title: A Feast Of Data, But No Free Lunch
text: According to FactSet, more than 82% of the 169 S&P 500 companies have reported beating Wall Street's expectations. This sets up an environment in which companies that don't exceed expectations can be met with more selling than celebration by investors.

title: The U.S. and European Union announce a joint deal on tariffs
text: The United States and the European Union agreed on Sunday to a trade framework setting a 15% tariff on most goods, staving off — at least for now — far higher import duties on both sides that might have sent shock waves through economies around the globe.The sweeping announcement came after President Donald Trump and European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen met briefly at Trump's Turnberry golf course in Scotland. Their private sit-down culminated months of bargaining, with the White House deadline Friday nearing for imposing punishing tariffs on the EU's 27 member countries.

title: Varney: President Trump is clearly the leader of the free world after EU trade deal
text: FOX Business' Stuart Varney analyzes the impact of President Donald Trump's trade deal with the European Union. #world #worldnews #us #foxbusiness #varney

title: Trump champions EU trade deal, as French PM slams it a ‘submission,' others balk
text: The new U.S.-EU trade agreement implements 15% tariff on European goods as EU leaders reluctantly accept terms, with France calling it "a dark day," while President Donald Trump celebrates the deal in Scotland.

title: We could go down the road of Trump's 2018 trade deal with China, warns AEI's Derek Scissors
text: Derek Scissors, AEI Asia economist, joins 'The Exchange' to discuss Trump's push for a deal with China and the hurdles and likely outcomes from the negotiations.

title: The Fed should be cautious about lowering rates, says GMO's Tom Hancock
text: Tom Hancock, Gmo portfolio manager, joins 'The Exchange' to discuss the Fed, risks of the AI trade and the markets.

title: Tech Sector Now 1/3rd Of S&P 500
text: Amid the AI Boom, the Technology sector's weighting in the S&P 500 has now eclipsed 1/3rd of the index. The only time the sector's weighting has been higher was during a brief window in early 2000 at the peak of the dot-com bubble.

title: Big Tech stock plays, meme stocks, Fed July meeting in focus
text: Big Tech earnings are on deck with Apple, Amazon, Meta, and Microsoft set to report this week. We break down what investors should look for, AI, and how to play these stocks.

title: The 'Halftime' Investment Committee debate earnings, the Fed and looming tariffs impact on markets
text: The Investment Committee discuss the speculative trade in the market as the S&P and NASDAQ continue to extend their record highs and a pivotal week beings for stocks.

title: Trump eyes 'world tariff' of 15-20% for most countries
text: President Donald Trump said on Monday most trading partners that do not negotiate separate trade deals would soon face tariffs of 15% to 20% on their exports to the United States, well above the broad 10% tariff he imposed in April.

title: From Allies To Adversaries: EU Settles For 15% Tariffs
text: The new EU-US trade deal sets a 15% baseline tariff on most goods, averting a trade war but ending near-zero tariff norms. US markets highlight promised EU investments and energy purchases, while EU leaders express disappointment, seeing the deal as damage control.

title: Fed May Open Door To Rate Cut After EU Tariff Deal
text: The Fed may be less worried over tariff-fueled inflation after President Trump's spate of trade deals.

title: Trump's massive economic trade deal with EU: What to know
text: President Donald Trump and EU Commission President Ursula von der Leyen announced a trade deal framework setting a 15% baseline tariff on most EU goods, down from Trump's planned 20% tariff.

title: Trump's $750 Billion EU Energy Deal Collides With Market Reality
text: Europe has pledged to increase purchases of American energy but exporters may struggle to meet demand.

title: An economic report card ahead of the next Fed decision
text: Eric Winograd, Chief Economist, AllianceBernstein, gives the economy a letter grade ahead of the Fed meeting. Transcript: CAROLINE WOODS: I'd love to do a bit of an economic check-in, if you will kind of an economic report card heading into this Fed meeting.

title: Low spirits for alcohol stocks despite better-than-feared trade deal
text: Some clarity for alcohol producers in the U.S. and Europe today following news of an EU trade deal. CNBC's Brandon Gomez unpacks why investors are still approaching the group with caution as they await more details for a possible exemption.

title: The market still has room to run from here, says UBS' Alan Rechtschaffen
text: Alan Rechtschaffen, UBS Global Wealth senior portfolio manager, joins 'Money Movers' to discuss markets, the next phase of the rally and his Fed outlook.

title: Trump: Global baseline tariff will likely be 15% to 20%
text: President Donald Trump said Monday that he will likely implement a blanket tariff between 15 and 20% on imports to the United States from countries that have not negotiated separate trade agreements. His comments come days before his Aug. 1 tariff deadline, and as dozens of countries have still not reached trade deals with the United States.

title: In A Bubbly Stock Market, This ETF Is One Big Beautiful 'BIL'
text: T-bills and ETFs like BIL remain highly attractive, offering competitive returns versus stocks with minimal risk since the Fed began raising rates in 2022. Holding T-bills provides a volatility buffer and lets me patiently observe market uncertainties, while still participating in equities with hedges.
